intro: Bothriocline ethulioides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow central disks surrounded by white to pink petals. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
